text:
Spora czapa dość trwałej piany, mahoniowa, opalizująca barwa samego trunku. Aromat drożdżowy, słodowy, zbożowy, do tego trochę rodzynek, suszonych gruszek, ciemnego miodu, karmelu... W smaku podobnie, półsłodkie, skojarzenia z kompotem wigilijnym, ciastem drożdżowym ze sliwkami, na finiszu sporo pikantnych fenoli. Goryczka niska, ziołowo przyprawowa, rozgrzewający alkohol, intensywne, drobne wysycenie, lekko wyklejające, nie gęste w odbiorze.

Poprawne piwo, dla mnie nieco brzeczkowe, drożdżowe w odbiorze, co ewidentnie mi przeszkadza.

Cloudy brown color and medium sized tan head. Plum aroma, dark fruit, everything nice but somehow weak. Taste is dried fruit and chocolate mostly, very nice. Full body, soft carbonation. Not my favorite style but this one is quite nice.

bruin met licht kaki kraag. aroma van mout, suiker, caramel, wat donker fruit. 
smaken medium zoet, medium bitter, caramel, mout, gist, lichte cacao, gist, matige body
normale co2

Robe brune, fine mousse, moyennement persistante. Nez élégant sur des notes chocolatées, café au lait, malt torréfié, noisette grillée, belle complexité dans son élégance. Bouche à lattaque onctueuse, pointe de café au lait, de la finesse, bulle crémeuse, de léquilibre, de la longueur et une finale sur les fruits secs et le café. Une très belle bière digeste et équilibrée.
Výtečné pivo se skvělou hořkostí, řízností i masivností. Dobré aroma. Hodně podobné Trappistu Rockerford.

33cl-fles van bij Bierhalle Deconinck te Vichte. U: Donkerbruin met een beige schuimkraag. G: Gedroogd fruit, noten, karamel en wat alcohol. S: Zoet, chocolade, gedroogd fruit en karamel. S: Zoet. Chocolade, rozijnen en noten. Lichte alcoholwarmte. M: Volmondig met medium carbonatie.

Thanks Sharky! Thick beige big head, lasting. Ruby-brown clear body. Dried red fruit and spice on pollen and strong maltiness. Very nice! Dry taste dominated by dry caramel and some estery fruitiness. Ends on a sugary note. Bit soapy.Nice enough.

Beautifull dark colour, nice noose, fantastic taste
caramel, herbs, brown sugar
brown, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, thin feel,

Bottle from the 2017 Manchester Beer Festival, drank at home. Brown pour with a beige head. nose of nuts, brown sugar, caramel, dark fruits, toffee. Flavours of toffee, sultanas, raisin, figs, chocolate and dark berries. Sweet, malty finish. Tasty stuff.

Bottle, 330 ml, courtesy of JFK10000. Shared with him and Miro. Pours brown with medium creamy beige head. Caramel, malty, toasted, brown sugar, some dried fruit. Moderate sweetness, average carbonation. Medium bodied.
Brown with white head. Caramel, Belgian esters and bread. Sweet, licorice and slight acidic finish. Great! A little generic.

750 ml bottle from Keg and Bottle. Aroma of overripe plum, raisin, dark bread, brown sugar, slight sour cherry, vinous. Dark brown/mahogany with a red hue. This is a dry beer with a lot of character, has a chocolate, fruit, spice thing going on, well balanced and tasty, malt forward. Medium body with a slick and creamy texture,lively carbonation, bittersweet finish. Recommended

Pours a very deep mahogany body with a large, creamy, tan head that reduces to a healthy layer, good lacing. Moderate flavour of sweet caramel, dark caramel, dark dried fruits, Belgian yeast, fermented apples, anise seeds and brown sugar. Moderate flavour of dark dried fruits, caramel, alcohol and some herbs. In the back I get anise seeds and liquorice. Moderate sweet and moderate bitter taste. Mid-bodied, light dry finish. A nice one, but a bit too weak and subtle.
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 2.5 years before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Aker Brygge, Oslo]

Bottle. Dark brown color with belge head. Aroma has dark fruits, caramel, malt, sugar. Taste is malty sweet with nice long a bit sweet aftertaste. Flavors of dark fruits, raisins, malt, caramel and some yeast.
Bottle. Thin foam ring. Aroma is plum, caramel, yeast and some chocolate. Taste is much of the same and the fruity notes dominated. Well carbonated. A good dubbel.

Dark brown, lots of carbonation. Aromas of fruits, some raisins, with an intense roasted aroma. Starts a bit sweet and quickly fades into a round fruity palate, to finish dry and roasty. Really lovely palate. Yeah, thats damn good.

Bottled 330ml. -Deep brown coloured, medium sized beige head, caramel in the nose. Sweet malty, caramel, dried fruits, notes of spices and alcohol with metallic touch. Rather sweet finish. Just another average beer.

Pours brown from the bottle. Tan, creamy head. Aroma is chocolate and chocolate with a subtle fruity undertone. Taste is cherry, vanilla, light chocolate. Medium carbonation. Medium body. Remains dry. Good.

330ml bottle. Pours an opaque red-brown with plenty of sediment floating around and a large, foamy, long lasting, tan head that laces. Sweet aroma of caramel malt, overripe dark fruit, brown sugar and light vinous. Sweet flavour of caramel malt, overripe dark fruit, bread, brown sugar and vinous with a mildly bitter, warming finish. Medium body with an oily texture and soft carbonation. Nice.

Bottle 33cl bought at Dranken Geers in Oostakker. Pours hazy dark brown with a big brown head. Nose: caramel, roasted malts, cookie dough, spices, coffee. Taste: medium carbonation. Creamy coffee texture with roasted malts and a medium bitterness. Slightly sweetness also with cookie dough notes. Dried fruits enters ever so slightly in the end.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2016 Robe brune avec des reflets rouges. Mousse beige rocailleuse aérée, bulles moyenne, tenue moyenne. Grosses bulles au versement, au fond du verre. Nez de malt grillé, épices et légère douceur (sucre candi), doucement alcooleux. Très peu de sucre, amertume assez présente. Notes de malt grillé (chocolat noir), fruits secs (noix), houblon amérisant, épice (réglisse). Texture moyenne. Corpulence moyenne pour une double. Double qui nest pas sur le sucre, le caramel, assez amère, particulièrement sèche. Longueur amère en finale.
Draft at PreFunk. Mahogany pour with small, spotty beige head. Pit fruit. Plums, brown sugar and yeast. Medium weight. Tasted good as I havent had a dubbel in a while.

Belle robe marron foncée avec des notes rubis, mousse rousse moyenne. Nez puissant de sucre candie, de caramel, de malts légèrement grillés et une pointe de banane. La bouche est sur les malts caramel et le sucre candie. Lalcool est fortement présent que ce soit au niveau de la chaleur quau niveau des esthers. La carbo est bonne, la longueur aussi. Très bonne double !

Hazy very reddish & dark brown color, solid beige head cover. Nose of toasted malt, plums and chocolate. Body is medium, carbon is solid, texture is medium. Taste is sweet and bitter. Palate is dominated by toasted malt, caramel, hops and sweet fruits as well as chocolate, chicory and coffee. Zwart bier met weinig schuim. Smaak is bitter hoppig en licht zoet met iets van chokolade en karamel. Tevens een licht fruitige ondertoon van bessen en kers. Mooie combinatie.

F: pale brown, huge, average lasting.
C: dark brown, non-transparent, red tones against the light.
A: malty, lingering fruity, raisins, caramel, hint of milk chocolate, spicy, hint of menthol, yeast.
T: malty, caramel, dark fruits, cherries, candy, roasted malt bitterness, raisins, toast, yeast, mocha, spicy, light oily mouthfeel, medium full body, average carbonation, very good balanced beer, worth to try, ABV 8,5%, 0,33l bottle from Maenhout supermarket in Oostende.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a creamy small tan head. Aroma of raisins, caramel, yeast and dark fruit. Flavor was sweet and malty with caramel, chocolate, dark fruit, roasted malts and some notes of brown sugar.
Chestnut brown color with yellowish head. Aroma of candy sugar and raisins. Taste of sweet malt, spices and dark fruit.

DAA; Bottle 33cl at Melkebaren. Pours large, dark brown with a lasting and lacing off-white to tan head. Nose is moderate, caramel, bread malt, light ripe plums, yeast and spice. Taste is medium sweet and bitter with a lasting, light warming finish. Body is medium, texture is oily to sticky, carbonation is soft to avarage.
UPDATED: APR 8, 2016 Sweet to the taste, smooth, highly carbonated. Remind me of Dogfish head Midas Touch. Not bad.

Pullo @ Saveur-Biere. Kaatuu tulppaaniin tummanrusekana ja sameahkonan, tiiviillä noin 1,5 sormen paksuisella vaahdolla. Tuoksussa on makeaa marjaisuutta, paahdettua sokeria, tummaa hedelmää ja mausteisuutta. Maussa makea sokerisuus hallitsee, mutta reilusti on mukana myös paahteisuutta, kuivattua hedelmää, anista ja muuta mausteisuutta. Suutuntuma on makeahko ja alkoholikin tuntuu hieman, yleisesti melko täyteläinen. Makeahkon mausteinen ja melko tasapainoinen dubbel, jossa hieman paahteisuutta, joka erottaa tämän tyylin muista oluista.

Amberfarget med fingerhøyt beige skum. Lukter brent karamell og såpe. Smaken er bitter brent karamell, noe sitrusskall og alkohol.
Lillestrøm ølfestival-Klimt
Clear light brown to amber color with medium beige head. Aroma is yeast, malt. Flavor is candy sugar, malt, roasted, sweet., some alcohol. Tasty.
ABV of 8.5 on the bottle. Aroma out of the bottle is pleasant but in the glass a tad too weak. Malty brew with caramel and alcohol. Creamy in the mouth.

Pretty good brew. Despite the commercial deScription there is some sweetness tho certainly not overdone. Flavors of herbs spices, rye, malt, yeast, carbonic tang. Excellent body is a little chewy which with perfect carbonation helps to make very drinkable beer.

Notes of darker fruit, toast, basement musty Belgian yeast esters. Clove, spice, alcohol. Pours darker reddish auburn, nice head. Flavors of toast, darker fruit, banana, clove, basement, tangy finish. Well carbonated, warming alcohol. Nice dubbel.

33 cl bottle at home. Pours unclear, dark brown with big, beige head. Aroma: malts and fruits. Notes of plum, raisins, roasted malts, coffee. Taste: high sweetness with low bitterness. Roasted malts. Notes of caramel, and coffee. Some notes of yeast. Texture is sticky. Carbonation is low

Helder bordeauxkleurig bier met lichtbeige schuimkraag. 
Zoetig en moutig in de neus met carameltoets. 
Mondgevoel is medium met milde koolzuur.
Smaak is zoet en moutig met een lichte kersentoets.
Afdronk is kort met lichte bitterheid op de achtergrond.

33cl bottle. Dark brown colour with a nice tan head. Raisins, nuts, sweet malt and yeast in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium to full body. Taste is sweet with some chocolate and nuts notes. Overall, a good beer.
aroma dark malt looks dark nice head flavor or dark malt caramel hints of liquorice full bodied

Dark brown colored with a ruby hue, some floaters, small creamy tan head, after a while only a ring. Aroma is of toffee, candy sugar, some toasted notes and Belgian yeast. Taste is medium+ sweet brewing sugar and toffee, some toast and bit of nuts, dark fruits and low spicy notes, Belgian yeast again. Sweetish finish with some accompanying roastiness. Medium bodied and carbonation.

Aroma: mild, malt, alcohol, raisins, nuts.
Taste: coffee, roasted, mokka, chocolat, caramel. Brown sugar.
Aftertaste had something bitter. Dry. Good mouthfeel.
Redbrown, beige head,creamy, lacing.

Bottle @ home. Some rust on the bottomside of the bottlecap and on the bottle, which shouldnt happen. Dark brown colour with a small off-white head. Smells alcohol, almond, sweet, quadruple, raisins. Smells slightly bread, sweet, almond, raisins. Full body, soft carbo. Expected way worse after seeing the cap.

33cl flesje via 8 Zaligheden, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 8,5%
Uitgeschonken in Leffe glas

Uiterlijk: donkerbruin/rood met mooie schuimkraag 

Aroma en smaak: caramel, gebrande mouten, warm van de alcohol, bitterzoet, donker fruit

Conclusie: rijke smaken, vind hem erg smakelijk

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Overly sweet dubbel. Too much brown sugar notes mixed in the somewhat malty presence. Not as hot as I would have thought though.
Belle mousse, couleur brun foncé. Légèrement sucrée. quasi pas damertume. Goûte un peu la réglisse en arrière goût.

33CL Bottle 
 Pours a dark brown with a big creamy beige head
 Aroma is sweet malt with bit of fruit
 Taste is sweet malt with burnt tones and a shortish dry finish,very good body
 overall a nice beer
Dark brown colour, with an off-white big head and lace. Aroma of chocolate, dark fruits, toffee.Medium body, sticky palate. TAste of toffee, chocolate, dark fruits. Good one.

Dark brown with light brown/yellow medium head. Roasetd malt anf yeast aroma. taste of roasetd malted with mild bitterness and coffee notes with sweet fruity yeat notes on background, some touch of vanilla.

33 cl bottle at home. Pours a deep mahogany red with a slightly off-white head. Aroma of slight roast, pear-drop and stewed fruit. Taste is very slightly sweet, then hugely bitter. Lots of flavours of rich stewed fruit, licorice and a lingering bitterness, balanced with a good mouthfeel. Overall, a really good beer.

Bouteille de 33cl, titre à 8,5%. Couleur cola, mousse moyenne, écume assez tenace. Arômes de caramel, de réglisse et autres plantes aromatiques. Texture assez crêmeuse. Trouvée à Vanuxeem - Ploegstaert.
amber colour,sweet beer,malt, caramel, toffee,liquorice with a nice balance

Aroma of malt, candy sugar, yeast, dark fruits, raisins, caramel, bread. Flavour is sweet with a smooth sweet finish. I am not usually a fan of sweet Abbey Dubbels, but this one has a really rich aroma to go with the sweetness.

From the corked, caged 750 ml. bottle. Not much of a cork pop. But it is an attractive looking reddish-mahogany tone with a lingering tan head. Decent enough clarity. The sweetness on the nose is a bit over the top as far as I am concerned. Very strong caramel, toffee, and brown sugar malt characters. I feel like I will get cavities due to that sweetness. Light cherry or juicy fruit character in there too. Medium to better than medium body. The taste is very sweet and malty with a mild to modest bitterness coming up from behind. I did not dislike it but sometimes a beer can bee too sweet
Bottle. Rich Christmas pudding aroma. Pours cloudy dark brown with good sized off white head. Well carbonated. Rich Christmas pudding flavour, full bodied with sweetness in the finish,

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2015 Pours clear amber-brown with two fingers of medium beige head (growing to more than three in the glass), excellent retention and lacing. (4/5) Nose is boozy dark fruit, red berries, dark malt, mild citrus. (8/10) Taste is moderate sweet, very mild bitter, slight tart. (8/10) Medium bodied, moderate to low carbonation, lingering boozy finish. (4/5)

"Brewed without spices"? Shut the f...ront door! The Belgians never fail to amaze me with what they can produce using no fruit or spices. An excellent abbey dubbel with an almost cola-like flavour and good integration of the fairly high ABV. Definitely worth trying. (16/20)

0.33 bottle. Hazy, dark brown color, and a small, brownish head. Sweet aroma of red fruits, dark chocolate, wood, some toasted malts, and obvious caramel. Taste is full of dark malts, some bitterness of a hard-to-discern origin, dark chocolate, and again delicate wood. Medium body, slick texture, and lively carbonation. Finish shows that the beer struggles to contain the alcohol, caramel makes a strong comeback, although in the end bitterness is the only thing that remains. Overall a mediocre example of its style.

(Bottle, Brugs Beertje, Brugge, 23 Oct 2014) Dark brown colour with dense, beige head. Malty nose with notes of caramel, dark fruit, raisins and a touch of liquorice. Malty taste with caramel, dark fruit, dark bread, chocolate, roasted malt and a gentle spicy bitterness. Almost full body, with a certain sweetness. Tasty, solid and well made dubbel. Nice one.

bottle @ Party Source / Bellevue KY --- Hazy very dark brown color, solid beige head cover, light streamers of lace. Aroma of toasted malt. Taste is toasted malt that is embellished by carbonation a hops through the finish. A solid brew, with malt that stays away from the caramel , hops that are present without dominating. And the alcohol is well-hidden. A pretty solid offering from Vicaris.
Bue en bouteille de 33cl. Ambrée, très maltée, sucre candi. Forte corpulence en bouche. Alcool un peu present.
Bue en bouteille de 33cl à la brasserie, couleur brune/rubis, belle mousse beige, effervescence moyenne, en bouche assez forte sur le malt caramélisée, puis sur la fraicheur dune pointe de réglisse.

Flasche (33 cl), MHD: 07/2015, somit zweieinhalb Jahre alt. - Tiefes Kastanienbraun mit rötlichem Schimmer, trüb. - In der Nase Röstmalz, milde Malzsüße, zart säuerliche Frucht. - Antrunk kräftig röstmalzig und nicht allzu süß mit Brotkruste, Lakritz, Pflaumenmus und etwas Schokolade. Die dunkelmalzige Süße ist ausbalanciert durch pikant-fruchtige Säure. Brauseartig rezent; für ein Bier dieser Schwere etwas dünn im Mund. Leicht weinig-alkoholisch und nur wenig fruchtig-herb im Abgang. - Ordentlich aber nicht so ganz mein Fall: zuviel Süßsauer und zu wenig Hopfen, auch zu rezent.

06/12/2014 @friends 33cl bottle
Dark brown-red colour. Nice rocky head. Roasted malts, caramel, dark fruits in the nose. Taste is roasted malts, sweetness, some bitterness.

Darft 0.15l at Vicaris stand Horeca Expo Ghent Belgium 2014.Pour it dark color with medium white head.Taste and aroma of roasted malt, totally reminds me on some dark lager like Crni Djordje from Banjaluka. Not so balanced and maybe thats the problem.
Medium mokka brown head, black colour with a bit off dark brown glow, malty maple sirup sweet caramel smell, medium carbonation and bitter some metal, malts liquorise/drop taste some herbs
Dark brown, soapy tan head. Aroma is all malt, some fruity esters. Malty, red fruit esters, really smooth carbonation. Nice beer.

Bottle from Post Office Vaults, Brum. In theory there is a right beer for any situation. When you hit the right beer, for the precise second youre in, its a special kind of victory. This hit all the spots. Lovely Dubbel. Light, fizzy. Beautiful blend of juicy tar and rich spicy malt. Great. Needed this.

Shared 11.2 oz. grenade-like bottle, with my portion poured to a sampler/rock glass, showing a clear, dark mahogany hue, with very frothy and persistent, tan head foam, and draping cling to the lacing. The nose was sweet, plum, and dark cherry. Medium bodied, with lively carbonation, the taste surprised with pronounced, roasted, dry & earthy hop bitterness, and somewhat hidden alcohol considering the modest amount in my glass. Flavorful & complex.

330mL bottle, 
Appearance: Deep dark burgundy / brown with a medium sized beige head. Aroma: Yeast, caramel and herbal notes, dark fruit
Taste: Not too sweet, even with all the sweet tones.( caramel,Licorice, dried fruit )and alcohol and yeast. in the finish.
medium body, average carbonation.

Scotch-style ale with a full chocolatey and caramelly malty main taste, dried fruits, coriander especially in the middle, drying a bit, smooth and somewhat powdery mouthfeel, warming alcohol in the finish (perhaps a bit astringent) and a hint of roasted coffee-like bitterness as well as herbal hops. Nice, but I have to re-rate it as it was still brewed at the Proefbrouwerij the last time I tasted it.

Ezerféle színben tündöklő illatai között leginkább a kékszőlő, szilva, mazsola, rumos dió, sült gesztenye aromája az, amit a krémes habpaplan alól a rendelkezésünkre bocsát. Mustos, borszerű jegyek, amikkel az ízlelés során is találkozhatunk. Krémes állagú, testes, ideális szénsavtartalmú ital, ízei között a likőrös, aszalt gyümölcsös, harapható élesztős alapvetésekkel, pirított karácsonyi nyalánkságok képeivel. Nagyszerű dubbel, a kategóriában véleményem szerint mindenképpen top 10-es alkotás.

Poured from bottle into Trappist glass a red brown with tan head and lace. Aroma is of fruits, dark and fig. Roasted malts come through. Theres an earthyness and a nice grain note. Alcohol is hidden in both taste and aroma. The taste is complex, grains, some hay in the malts. Bready like a darker euro the. Figs and maybe the slightest coffee note. For a 8.8 ABV the alcohol is not in the taste at all. Although malty it is not sweet. The finish is the same but for me the figs get a little stronger as it warms. This bottle was supposed to be matured by seller and I had it for about about six months. What I thought was the date on 750ml bottle was to worn to see. Loved it
Roodbruine kleur met een volle blijvende crèmekleur kraag. Ruikt iets zoetig, gebrand, chocolade. Smaakt zacht, vanille, iets zoetig en tikkeltje bitter. Beetje creamy afdronk.

Deep dark brown colour, beige creamy head. Rich nose with sweet dried fruits like plums and figs, roasted malts with chocolate and coffee notes. Taste is quite complex with the mentioned aroma tones nicely balanced, big on roasted malt flavours, liquorice, a bit smoky, clove, gingerbread, a little bitterness. Lingering rich aftertaste. High carbonation, good body, prickly mouthfeel.

Average frothy off-white head that slowly diminishes. Body is dark copper.
Aroma's of cookies, hay, molasses, roasted malts, orange, dough, grape, rasin, date, tawny port, cola, forest fruits, cinnamon, apple, brown sugar.
Flavor is light acidic, then light acidic, light sweet and light bitter, then light acidic and sweet and finally light bitter.
Body is medium with creamy texture and soft carbonation.
Lovely beer full of aromas and subtlely shifting flavors.

Definitely more dubbel then Belgian ale, but quite a good one. Pours a deep red/black with a bubbly tan head. Smells of peach lollipops, with some maltiness thrown in. Taste has dubbel overtones, with lots of maltiness, and a bit of molasses in the finish. Paired with seared scallops with bacon spinach hash, the beer is smoothed out, the maltiness is cut down. Had in the bottle.
Een lekker donker biertje met een uitgesproken smaak. een aanrader voor mensen die van donkere bieren houden

Brune foncée, effervescence moyenne-faible, col brun clair crémeux avec une belle dentelle sur le verre. Malts rôtis, caramel, réglisse légère, fruits noirs assez présents, un rien de moka, bonne petite amertume en fin de bouche, un rien trop sucrée => à regoûter vieillie.

Huge well lasting foam. Roasted malty notes. Fine tannin tart dryness. Chocolate roasted coffee taste. Medium mouthfeel. Smooth. Fine brew.

Bottle from Den Zytholoog, Maldegem. Dark brown colour, white/beige foam. Sweet aroma of dark fruit, raisins, plums with some brown sugar. Also caramel flavour. Light bitter aftertaste. Very good dubbel.

dark orange brown some tan head. Aroma of raisins, rye german bread. tastes bready grapey, german rye loaf. Clean creamy finish very dry, mid dark barley. well concealed alcohol. Unusually drinkable for a dubbel.

Bottle from a friend. Unable to discern color as Im having this in a low-light environment. Aroma is nice with coffee, roasted malt and hints of licorice. Taste follows suit with a nice if not great lingering in the mouth. I didnt know what to expect and was very positively surprised by both aroma and taste.

Bottle - Light boozy dark malts, raisin and dark sugars with some cocoa. Cloudy maroon with a large light brown head. Light molasses and lots of dark sugars. Very nice, long and rich sugars throughout.
Dry and malty Belgian brownd beer. Not as sweet as the usual Belgian. Very yeasty of course.

330mL bottle, pours a deep dark burgundy / brown with a medium beige head. Aroma is super yeasty and musty, with light herbally notes. Flavour is very similar, with more of the herbal and some vegetal notes also upfront, with a very yeasty body. Doesnt seem so refined really. Good, but needs some refining.

Cloudy reddish-brown, beige head. Nose is caramel, yeast, dark fruit, Flavor is malt, dried plums, caramel, yeasty notes. Licorice, dried fruit and alcohol in the finish. Lingering fruit and malt. Fizzy mouthfeel. Pretty good.

Bottle @ home. Schiuma beige non molto fine abbastanza persistente. Colore marrone riflessi rosso rubino, opalescente. Aroma intenso complesso di liquirizia, cacao, lievito belga liquore, caramello, frutta secca. Dolce amabile, poco acida, si ritrovano caramello, cioccolato, malto zucchero di canna e nocciola. Poco corposa ,calda, rotonda perfettamente bilanciata ed armonica. Grande dubbel.

An extremely complex belgian strong Beer. A beautiful red color and every time you taste it, you discover something new! At nose is fantastic and it persists for long time in your mouth. Red fruits, but also coffee and a little bit of tropical! Amazing!
750 ml bottle. Raisin aroma. Sweet. Candy sugar. Brown sugar. Nice malt. Pretty damn good.

0,33l fles gedeeld met nikos. Donker bruin met een flinke lading gist en een ivoorkleurige kraag. Geur was rozenbottels met gist. Mooi vol mondgevoel zoetje aanwezig maar niet overheersend. Echt een hele goede Belgisch dubbel.

Buon aroma (anche se non particolarmente persistente): si percepisce del maltato, frutta secca e tostato. In bocca si percepisce decisamente il maltato, con qualche sentore di frutta secca. Lalcol si sente nella bevuta, ma non in maniera decisa. Una buona dubbel, anche se non alla pari con quella di la Trappe e Chimay.

0,33L bottle, BB 07.08.16 (ABV 8,5%). Pours very dark brown-black with light tan head. The head stays. Aroma is dark fruits, metallic, malt, and yeast. Taste is dark bread, sweet, malt, dark fruits, roast, caramel, some wood and spices. Finish is caramel and roast bitterness. Overall: surprised by the intense handmade dark rye bread flavor. It really feels like drinking liquid dark bread.

Bottle 8,5%. Brown body, tall creamy head. Beautiful. Aroma has a warm bready roastiness and hints of Belgian yeast. Toasty and nutty taste with a really good balance. Good dry and toasty finish which always leaves you wanting to take another sip. Very good.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.
Dark, red brown with big offwhite head. Aroma has yeast, fruit, funk. Flavour is sweetish, juicy, dried fruit and boozy alcohol. Really nice.

Bardzo dobre klasztorne dubbel. Ciemne z liczna poswiata czerwieni. Ale sporo tez ciemnej mazi na dnie po dolaniu brudzi piwo do barwy ciemno brazowej i nieprzezroczystej. W smaku karmel, brazowy skarmelizowany cukier, biszkopty i na koniec podpieczony chleb tostowy. Zapach dojrzalych sliwek w czekoladzie. Troche porto ale nie wyczuwa sie alkoholu. Glebia smaku i tresciwosci. Piwo o sporej gestej i puchatej bezowej pianie. Polecam

Bottle 330 ml. Pours copper brown with thick beige head. Aroma:malt, dark fruits, berries, nuts and caramel. Taste: very fruity. Sweetness is well balanced. Hints of malt, nuts and caramel. Full bodied. Creamy texture. Leaves a dry aftertaste. Good dubbel.

33cl served in a Trappist glass. Pours a well carbonated dark brown colour with the best head I have seen - thick, foamy and off-white. The aroma is malty and warming. Tastes of coffee, malts and dusty chocolate - much like the Westvleteren 8. One of the best dubbels I have tried. Less fruity than a typical - say St. Bernardus Prior 8 - dubbel but no worse off for it. Try it if you can.
Pours a dark brown red beer with a good tan head. Smells sweet fruits, malts, honey. Tastes sweet, licorice, malts. Average carbo, medium body and a sticky texture.
Brown, great dense off white head. Creamy smooth and soft. Malty caramellish aroma. Not sweet at all in the taste, more bitter. nice. Warming with some alcohol in it shown. Not bad at all, good one.

Dark ruby body, low tan almost brown head. Aroms is full of catamel, candi, toffee, really high on it. Taste is caramel syrupy sweet, low almost none bitterness. Sweetness well balanced, toffee after taste. Body full, medium carbonation.
At BBF. Brown colour with off-white head. Vanilla, malt and caramel aroma. Vanilla, sweet, caramel taste, slightly acid. Medium body.

Bottle from a friend. Dark brown color, beige head. Bitter taste with chocolate, earthy notes, dark fruits, toast, toffee and a bit of syrup. Bitter finish with roasted malts, toffee and dark fruits. Excellent abbey dubbel.
Pours a dark colour, taste is spicy with some liquorice, warming finish, not bad
Bottle 0.33l at HBF 2014, Helsinki. BBE 21/01/17. Colour is murky brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Belgian yeast, dark fruits and malts. Pretty soft.

Bottle. Pours a very cloudy brown color with a huge light tan head on it. Nose is sweet with some slight caramel and rock candy elements coming off it. Taste is also slightly sweet and has some bread and candy elements in there. Meh.

Dark murky brown pour with frothy light beige head. Aroma of malts, fruit, yeast, caramel and bread dough. Taste of malts, bready, caramel, yeast, faint plums and a slightly dry peppery finish. Full bodied, higher carbonation, very nice example of an abbey dubbel!
Aroma is complex fruit/fruitcake, malts and a hint of sweetness. The flavor is fruit, berries, toffee, malts and a mild/medium sweet and slightly sticky finish.

The taste starts out sweet with flavours of brown sugar, dark fruit, caramel and some spice. Theres a malt character and a Belgian yeast backbone. The hops presence is mild but complementary and brings some balance.
Roasted aroma, lacks the strong dominating scent of the Vicaris Winter (which is a positive thing) but still retains the flavour.

bottle picked up at pivni rozmanitost in prague. very excitable bottle - plenty of froth ended up on the floor, what ended up in the glass was light brown with a reddish tinge. plenty of stonefruit in the aroma along with cocoa powder; hints of candi sugar and earthy spice, finishing quite dry

This Belgian Ale pours a dark brown with a perfect white head. Dont over refrigerate this beer otherwise you will be left with no scent and very little flavor. I should go to a real beer bar next time! ;)
Aroma is bit of belgian yeast,sugar cane and a variety of fruits like plum and apple . Taste is fruity with an alcohol. Appearance is a cloudy orange/yellow body with lower head retention

Pours copper with a medium fluffy brown head. Aroma is dark fruits, plum, raisin, candied sugar and earthy. Taste is sweet with moderate bitters, mostly sweet. Medium bodied, smooth texture. Very solid.

33cl Bottle at Tripel, Adam. Dark brown beer, beige head. Aroma of burnt caramel, malts, dark fruits, hint of chocolate, yeast. Flavour is medium-sweet, quite dry, malty, dark fruits, cocoa powder, hint of chocolate, malty and yeasty bitter finish. Medium-bodied, a bit fizzy. Expected more of this.
Poured deep reddish brown with a frothy tan head. Aroma of spicy fruit and soft malt. Medium body, slightly sweet, flavour of mild dark fruit, caramel malt, light toasted malt.

Color marrón oscuro, abundante cabeza de espuma beige que perdura; aromas muy marcados a caramelo, higos, frutos negros y licor; en boca entrada maltosa con trago suave; cuerpo ligero con carbonatación media, alcohol bien integrado y poco amargor, notas a especias y pos gusto un tanto seco.

Like this one. Pours murky brown with an initial foamy head and no lacing. Nose is toffee and brown bread.notes of toffee, brown bread, raisins and maybe a very slight almost cherry in the back. Taste is med/light sweet and with very little bitterness. Full body, light creamy with medium carbonation. Really nice beer.

330ml bottle. Murky copper color. Massive size, thick off-white head, stays. Raisins, plums, fruits, alcohol in aroma. Fizzy aroma. Alcohol, chocolate, licorice, mild roast, woody and ashy flavors. Dark chocolate in aftertaste. Creamy texture.

Bottle. Dark mahogany with a dense light brown head. Lovely bready dark malts and dark fruits profile, prunes, cherries, raisin pie. Rustic yeast character, dry slightly tannic finish. The ABV is well hidden.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
Clear dark brown, light brown head
Toasted malts, winey, maraschino, cacao
Sweet, lightly bitter ending
Licorice, sour cherries in rhum "monchery", chocolate
Perfectly balanced
Astonishing beer, one of the best I ever tasted

My first from this new Belgian brewer and I'm quite impressed. Pours mahogany with a thick off white head. The aroma has some caramel and fruit. The flavor has the caramel to start with the fruit coming through. The hops are present with a well balanced bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle. Dark red/brown with big, ivory head.
NOSE : strong tart and burned caramel aromas. They escalate to brownie like and nutella. It has a sweet cheese with raisins and vanilla like aromas. While strongly shaken it reveals coffee and mountain honey notes. 
SIP : medium body with oily texture. Strong carbonation. Sweet and roasty. Gets a bit dry like coffee. Finish is dry and bitter like coffee and citrus seed. Aftertaste is bitter chocolate and mud like. Flavors are rich with sweet molasses or maple syrup. Strong burned caramel and black chocolate. Fruits aromas are of dried raisins, plums and figs. Sourness is comparable to dried fruits. Bitter notes remind more of cacoa and coffee and a hint of citrus seeds. 
OVERALL : its a really great dubbel. One of the best I tried. Rich and boozy. This one is getting on my top list.
Dark brown, average head. Plums and spices, caramel. Very dry, light bitterness too. Very enjoyable and strong.

Aroma : Dried red fruit, caramel, bit of cheese Appearance: Brown amber, red glow, thick big bubble head, thick lace, beige head Taste: Coffee, hint of liquorice, bit sweet, little bitterness aftertaste, dried dark fruit, very nice beer. Greetz from Alex.

Bouteille de 750 ml, avec bouchon de liège, obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Odeur de caramel et de petits fruits. Apparence: La couleur est brune avec une très faible densité de bulle. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de caramel avec une pointe de céréale grillée et de petits fruits. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de caramel en arrière goût. (Rating #5341)

My Bottom Line:
Cherries crushed on moist earth, minerals peering through high effervescence, raisins and chocolate lifted by alcohol; a fun Dubbel.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam floats atop the mahogany-hued dark brown.
-Pumpernickel bread allusions appear in the middle.
-Alcohol is not a bother at all.
-Minerality is quite high; hard water-like.
-Nice drinkability for an 8.5% brew.
-This is drier than your average Dubbel.

Bottle.

Pours a merky brown with a nice creamy tan head that leaves adequate lace on the glass. Aroma is rich maltiness, caramel, chocolate, dark dried fruits(raisins and plums) and lightly sppicy(cloves). Flavours are rich sweet maltiness, caramel, toast, chocolate, raisins, plums, moderate cloves, light alcohol and faint bitterness. Solid double!

Dark brown, huge full brown head. Nose: chocolate, caramel, spices, but also something earth, alcoholic. Taste is creamy, soft, sweet, coffee, caramel, chocolate. Good body. Very well balanced, very enjoyable beer

Merci à Boutip pour la bouteille! 

La bière nous accueille avec une énorme et magnifique mousse. La Generaal a un goût assez fade, je naime pas trop pour être franc. Le corps est aussi plutôt aqueux. 

Jen suis le premier surpris, mais je narrive pas à trouver beaucoup de qualités à cette bière, outre sa magnifique mousse. Peut-être suis-je tombé sur une mauvaise bouteille?

Bottle at bierhuyske 
Pours very dark brown
Rather small darker white foam 
Smell is sweet earthyness 
Good carbo . Very nice chocolate/ metallic / unique taste . Bit chocolate in aftertaste

Bottle 33 cl, BBE 27.07.2015. Pours hazy mahogny in color with a creamy tan head. 
Brown sugar, dark syrup and sweetish overripe dark fruits with dark bready malty 

notes in aroma. Slightly vinous on the nose as well. Quite dry mouthfeel. Ripe 

plums, dark breadyness, even if does not feel that sweet in this case and some 

cocoa notes in taste. A bit of licorice and plum liqour notes in aftertaste. Nice 

and tasty abbey dubbel.

This was a surprise. Pours lively with big foam head and scent of Chocolate, raisins and citrus. Bit of lemon balm. Dark, moody and with a creamy head. Taste is superb. Chocolate, tonnes of roasted malts, some sweetness but nut too much, fudge, slight citrus, alcohol. Some spiciness from hops and yeast. Absolutely delicious and, dare I say it, better than Straffe Hendrik Quadrupel.

Good oaky brown ale type stuff with nice aged notes. Fruity but a little too gentle in the nose. Flavour is mainly more fruit, brown sugar and sweet malt with a bit of chocolate. Sweet and bitter finish. Very fond of this one.

Bottle: Poured a dark brown color ale with a large light brown foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of dry fruits with quite a bit of residual sugar and some Belgian biscuit malt notes. Taste is dominated by light dry fruits notes with some Belgian cookie malt and quite a bit of residual sugar. Body is full with good carbonation and no apparent alcohol. Not bad overall but lacking complexities for the style.

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle corked and capped poured into a trappist glass. Pours translucent brown with reddish hue and medium light brown head. Thick small bubble lacing, well carbonation, and sweet dark fruit aroma. Taste is dark candy sugar and dark fruit.
Dark brown with big brown foam head lacing to glass. Aroma is bit caramel, bit nutty, bit hoppy. Taste is not too sweet, bit strong bitterness. Interesting beer. (Velp 201310)

À louverture de la bouteille, il y a une intense odeur de cassonade, en plus dune présence de levure. Dans le verre la cassonade est moins présente et la levure a disparue, mais cest plus fruité, telle une prune. La mousse est beige avec un goût sucrée. Au goût, cest encore la cassonade, mais il y a un côté prune et caramel lorsquelle se réchauffe. Pour une bière à près de 9% il ny a pas de présence dalcool dans lodeur ou dans le goût. En général, je trouve que cest une bonne Dubbel, mais elle manque de complexité, de subtilité.

330ml bottle, dark ruby-mahogany color, with a big rocky beige head, with a yeasty, fruitcake, cookie dough, dark dried fruit nose, with some faint coffee, candi sugar, plum juice, molasses notes, with some toasted, caramelized, light roasted malt, faint chocolate, spicy notes in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a yeasty, sweet toasted, caramelized, bready maltiness, faint fruity dark cherry character with some dried fig, raisin, date, candi sugar, raisin pie, chocolate flavours, within a fuitcake backbone, leading towards a yeasty, sweet malty, dark dried fruitiness finish.

Bottle. Moderate cereal and roasted for the malt, faint orange for the hops, moderate dough for the yeast, with date, toffee and brown sugar. Head is small, frothy, beige with good lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is murky dark brown. Flavor starts lightly sweet and moderately acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and moderately bitter. Palate is medium, watery with a fizzy carbonation. More acidic and bitter then most Abbey Dubbels, but still a tasty beer

Dark red brown beer with quickly disappearing foam. Smells of liquorice, hints of coffee and caramel in the aroma. Full body, relatively bitter finish which is a bit surprising, Certainly not sweet or sour

Botlle 33 cl. Pours dark brown with a small head that leaves some traces to the glass and an aroma of caramel, malts, some hops, licorice, raisin, chocolate and molasses. On the taste theres licorice again, herbs, ripe fruits, chocolate, nuts, cream and some alcohol. A nice and pretty original double!

Bottle from ABC Leuven. Dark brown with orange-red tints and a huge, airy head. Big malty nose, chocolate, fudge, raisins, treacle, orange. Rich and malty. This is the kind of thick, juicy dubbel I dig. Chocolate fudge and tracle, with dried fruits, and just enough tart orange and bitter hop to balance it balanced. Finishes quite clean and dry. Rich and thick body. Slightly roasty in the finish. Excellent.

pours hazy light brown-reddish with a creamy light beige head, very good retention and strong lacing. raisins, toasted and caramelized candi, dry caramel, spices - anisseed, booze and light sweetness, bit of dust amd metal, root beer and bubblegum. lively to average carbonation, light to medium body, short but assertive grassy-spicy-earthy finish. very nice dubbel. enjoyed it!

330ml bottle from IPB.
Appearance : Deep amber with medium head.

Aroma : Spices and belgian yeast. Cooked caramel and toffee. Lots of caramel. 

Taste : Caramel with spices and belgian yeast. Light bitterness. Some overcooked caramel astringency. Finish spicy with caramel. Some herbal hops with some yeast. Fairly dry. Light roasted malts. Not much alcohol.

Overall : Nice caramel. Almost an hybrid between a scotch ale and a belgian ale. Nice sharp finish to cut thru the caramel. Well made and pretty tasty.

Bouteille de 33cl 8,5% Bière cuivrée (noisette) avec un filet de mousse. Un nez de fruits secs, de raisins, sucre brun. Une bouche étonnante, sucrée mais pas trop, des saveurs de fruits secs, raisins, et de noix.

SAQ special import. Pours a deep amber colour with lots of tiny particles. Big creamy-froth beige head, great retention and some foamy lace. Aromas are all over the place with some mild sourness, some roasted malts, dark fruits (raisins, plums), licorice, molasses and grassy hops. Slight creamy and mostly wet mouthfeel. Very light dryness in the finish, but more tart. Again, lots of dark fruits in the taste, with some mild chocolate malt and the rusty hop which I am not a fan. Other than that, decent dark Belgian Strong Ale.

18 Aug 2013, tap. Red/brown. Nose is red grapes and cereal malt and wet bread, maybe some soft/rancid fruit. Med body and a tad fizzy. Grape jelly, toast, dry finish. Ok. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is a fuckin wierd bee.r I give it respect for its uniqueness but wow I cant even explain this flavor. Like some kind of marijuna tea mixed with dirt.

33 cl. Une bière brune et un petit col qui veut laisser quelques traces. Au nez, ce sont des parfums de réglisse et de mélasse qui se signalent à travers des élans chocolatés et des vapeurs de tarte aux raisins. Intéressant! Sur les papilles, ce sont des morceaux de réglisse noire, dépices et de fruits qui vont et qui viennent à travers des saveurs de chocolat, de pâte de noisettes et dalcool plutôt floral. En bouche, cest un corps délicatement crémeux qui fait doucement vibrer ma langue. En finale, ce sont des notes sèches et légèrement chaudes qui finissent par mimpressionner. Voilà une double qui est bien plaisante à boire. Heureusement, il me reste une autre bouteille.

330 ml bottle. Pours a very dark orangeish brown with a very, very resilient, thick, beige head. Aroma is hazelnut, chocolate, coffee. Flavor is tons of hazelnut, milk chocolate, crème brûlée....that is pretty much it, but its so well balanced its maddeningly good.Finish is some more hazelnut, and coffee bitterness. Medium body, creamy and sticky mouthfeel, average carbonation. Excellent, top quality dubbel, by my standards.
330 ml bottle, 8,5% abv. Reddish brown with mocca colored head. Aroma malty and rich, raisins, vinous and dark caramel. Taste of malt, caramel, small yeast notes, alcohol and dark fruit. Nice

HOME 20130730 (33 cl bottle, 8.5 % ABV): A clear, dark amber (slightly red) coloured beer with a thin, fine beige head. Aroma: roasted malt, sweet, caramel (licorice). Coffee, toffee and raisins. The taste is some roasted malt and sweetness. Further fruity (raisins), caramel, and chocolate. In the final sweet, a malty, roasted bitterness and alcohol. A full body beer as can be expected for a dubbel. The beer is somewhat sticky in the mouth.

330 ml stubby bottle, at Cafe Moortgat, Arnhem. Into a chalice. ABV 8.8%
Deep brown-red colour, big off-white head with good retention and light lacing left on the glass.
Aroma is of sour red grapes, is this one infected too? I dont get any of the typical dubbel aromas.
Taste is also sour. I had troubles drinking this one, but after it warmed up, the sourness seems to retreat and both on the aroma and on the taste some roasted malts and light chocolate were traceable.
Medium bodied, good carbonation.
Marked for re-review sometime in the future, just to make sure my bottle wasnt bad.

Brown bottle, 33 cl, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savoured on July 22 2013; eye: mahogany, semi-opaque, voluminous beige head made up of rather large bubbles and that turns into a ring; nose: malt, caramel, light alcohol, light plum, light spices; mouth: malt, caramel, light alcohol, plum, light spices, alcohol, light acridness, alcoholic finale with presence of malt, medium-full body, good carbonation, mildly sweet, lightly alcoholic texture; overall: correct

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 33 cl, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savourée le 22 juillet 2013; il : acajou, semi-opaque, mousse beige volumineuse formée de bulles plutôt grosses et qui se transforme en un anneau, bonne dentelle; nez : malt, caramel, léger alcool, léger prune, léger épices; bouche : malt, caramel, léger alcool, prune, léger épices, alcool, légère âcreté, finale alcoolique avec présence de malt, corps moyen-corsé, bonne carbonatation, moyennement sucrée, texture légèrement alcoolique; en résumé : bien
Bottle at Bierhuiske, Antwerp. Almost redish/dark brown beer with a big beige head. Malty and dried dark fruits aroma. Raisins, plums, sweetish, malty flavour. A really nice beer :-)

Bottle 330ml.
Pours dark brown with very high creamy beige head. Nice lacing. Aroma is of dark fruits, caramel, sugar, malt. Taste is of dark fruits, caramel, sweetness, sligthly roasted malt, some underlying bitterness. Palate: Medium body. Sticky. Overall: Sweet. A tad harsh. Not easily drinkable. A decent dubbel, but lacking finesse-wise.
brown, cloudy, tan foam, coffee, roasty, leather, woody, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, creamy, average carbonation,
brown, hazy, tan foam, roasty, toast, caramel, full body, creamy, average carbonation, medium sweetness, medium bitterness,

33 cl bottle from Bieropholie, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. 
App.: Deep mahogany, cloudy?, with a full light deep tan head.
 
Aroma: Quite vinous off the start, licorice-molasses, very dark, lacks the dark dried fruitiness expected of the style, very dark bread crust (rye bread?), finally some dark dried fruits.
 
Palate: Medium+ body, smooth, somewhat relaxed effervescence.
 
Flav.: Vinous, light root beer herbals, very dark, black strap molasses and licorice, still not as much fruitiness expected for a Dubbel, dark rye crust; dry with minimal bitterness, light tartness and a fairly long, inky, almost molasses finish.

Different.

RBESG 2013. Bottle at Antwerp Bierhuiske. Very dark amber/brown beer with a nice beige/brownish head. Malty fruity aroma, toffee, figs, caramel, prunes, raisins, some vinous notes. Sweetish malty flavor, caramel, prunes, plums, raisins, warming alcohol, vinous, some grapes.
Licorice and malt, was this brewed 3 years yore? Brown with bubbly head. Bang on aroma. Middling bang on mouthfeel. OK drinkability, better with a meal.
Bottle. Amber colour with a beige head. Aroma is sugar, yeast, caramel, dried fruits, roasted malt. Flavour is sugar, roasted malt, sugar, caramel, yeast, dried fruits. Full body. OK beer.

Pours a red-ish brown with a thin white head that leave some lacings. Aroma is discrete with plums, sugar and raisins. Taste is not sweet, feeling sour at times (there must be some kind of acidity in there). Flavors are green grapes, candi sugar, molasse. Overall an OK dubbel, nothing extraordinary.

Bottle (330 ml). Unclear brown with reddish reflect, a small beige head and little lacing. Aroma is of nuts, berries and light caramel. Taste is moderately sweet with nuts, berries, light caramel and spices (even if they brewed the beer without spices). Medium body. Moderate to lively carbonation. Average to good Dubbel.
Bottle at home. Nice dark beer. Fresh fruit flavour in combination with dark fruits and a hint of chocolate

Draft at Alla Spina. Pours a deep brownish red with bubbly tan head and lace. Notes of plums, cherries, raisin, oak, vanilla, toffee. Medium body and slightly tart. Reminds me a little of St. Vincent. Really nice dubbel

Bière brune de caractère. Procédé de brassage vigoureux, qui transmet son caractère
à la bière. Etiquette sobre. Force de 8,8 % abv. Bouteille basse du type Duvel.
Couleur brun roux profond. Clarté nette. Bulles assez grosses partout dans le verre.
Mousse beige clair qui vient napper, crémeuse.
Arômes de pomme de terre cuite, raisins secs, pain complet, avec une pointe de kirsch.
1ère bouche soyeuse mais structurée, sur du café, moka, et une pointe de mûres.
Arrière-bouche de céréales, genièvre, gin et une fine pointe dépices.
2ème sur du malt torréfié et du houblon ferme.
3ème sur du café, noix, noisettes, amandes pilées.
Arrière-bouche sur du bois de fût, épices muscadées, houblon amer.
Longueur avec de grands accents, de la vigueur et de la profondeur.
Levure douce, fine, précise, bien pour une brune.
Alcool bien dosé, pas du tout exagéré, mais pas faible non plus.
Finale où on navigue avec un capitaine qui connaît son métier.
Une bière qui tient la ligne sur toute la dégustation, plutôt du genre vigoureuse,
mais dotée de beaucoup de saveur(s).
Pours brown ,dark ruby colour with cloudy, creamy tan head. Aroma is roasted malts some sweetness and yeast. Taste is also roasted malts, caramel, yeast. Medium mouthfeel.
Bottle.Pours brown with beige head. Aroma of malt, caramel, alcohol and red apples. Flavo ri sweet and malty with some caramel, brown sugar and bitter red apples. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle. A creamy, beige head leaving lacings forms over a dark copper to light brown body. Dried fruits in the aroma, having company of some light roasted malts and chocolate. A touch of spices too. The flavor has an underlying bitterness, dealing with the sweetness and dried fruis. Full body, pleasant carbonation. Bitter finish with dried fruits and some chocolate notes. A decent one, but far from as clean as some of the best dubbels. 130430

Bottle 330ml @ Geokkjer
Pours deep reddish brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, bread, hint of chocolate and alcohol. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and light bitter with a long chocolate, caramel and bread finish.Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

On tap. Pours with a hazed mahogany hued body with a medium sized yet retentive off-white head. Aromas are largely musty apple, sulfur, lightly acidic, old books, curacao, estery, low malt, raisins, plums, no hop. Flavors are watery, sour apple, brown sugar, musty, low malt, slight bubblegum. Lively bubbles hide a thinner body. Lowish pH.

Bottle that exploded into a massive fountain when I opened it. Pours dark brown with fine light brown head. Aroma is fruits, especially plums, licorice, spices and alcohol. Flavor is fruits, malt and some butter tones.

Mahogany pour with an off-white head. Nose is unpleasant. Green apple, paper, metal, and lemon juice. Some sweet banana, toasted bread, pepper, yeast, and a hint of cola. Not an enjoyable flavor, either. Leather, pepper, paper, metal, and lots of green apple. Notes of lemon zest, toasted bread, and tons of pepper. Kind of watery, too.

33 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20110322.
Pours dark copper color with a medium sized head. Aroma of caramel malts, licorice notes, yeast, mild spice notes and ripe fruits, some toffee also. Flavor of dark malts, caramel, some yeast and ripe fruits. Excellent.
Hele donkere kleur, met klein rode tint. Je.ruikt goed het fruit. Prima van smaak.....

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2013 On tap. Poured brown with brown head. Odd. Very spicy, peppery smell. Taste is peppery too. Thick. Unusual for a dubbel. Not very good for my taste buds. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at thirdeye11s birthday party. Brown color with a tan head. Aroma is a mix if malt, yeast, dark fruit and candy sugar. Flavor is more of the same. I get a lot of caramel as well as some cherries and raisins, as well as some brown sugar. Pretty nice.

Bottle @ Christers. Pours dark amber with a creamy offwhite head. Aroma of malt, yeast, caramel, dark fruits, spices. Flavor is malts, caramel, dark fruits, spice. Medium body, lively carbonation. 040213

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Hazy reddish brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dark fruit and light spicy. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish with warming alcohol. 040213
Bottle, 8.8%. Dark amber with medium beige head. Aroma is malt, dark fruits, yeast and plume. Flavour is malt, yeast, dark fruits, caramel, medium sweet and plume.
Bottle. Nice creamy head with excellent duration. Color is brown. Aroma and taste are candy sugar, caramel, dried fruits, malt and hops.

Bottled. Pours hazy red brown with a medium sized, creamy, beige head, leaving a fair lacing. Aroma of slightly roasted malt, chocolate, nuts and yeast. Sweet flavor that ens up more dry with some bitter notes. yeast. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft CO2. A very enjoyable dubbel. ★★★★

Tasted on 1/27/13 from a corked and caged 750mL bottle from the Rare Beer Club. Pours a very dark mahogany color with a very thick beige head that slowly recedes to super thick and rocky lace. The nose is malty but dry with cocoa nibs, some chocolate, cola, and vanilla. The flavor is the same, very dry with the cola notes up front, moving to the toasted cocoa nibs and a nice dose of roasted bitterness. The body is medium with lively carbonation and a long cola and bitter roasted finish.
33cl bottle from labiere.pt. Dark brown color. Medium head. Medium sweetness and bitterness. Malt, fruit and alcohol aroma.
Bottle shared at Chads birthday.  Blackish red pour with a tan head.  Aroma is tart and dark fruit.  Taste is more dark fruit but with an almost dark chocolate character along with the tartness.

Bottle.  Pours clear dark brown with a large, frothy light tan head, medium retention with good lacing.  Aroma is dates and plums, nutty, caramel, and toast malt with oak notes and earthy hops.  Flavor is malt dominant with dark fruity esters, Belgian candi sugars, light hops and bitterness with a sweet finish.  Full body and medium carbonation.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a cloudy, murky brownish with a dense and creamy beige head. Some overripe dark fruit in the nose with a little phenols. Rich body, heavy carbonation, overripe dark fruits, a little chocolate and a slightly tart edge. Subdued bitterness. 271212
On tap at Theresas.  Fairly thin for the style, with flavors of brown sugar, figs, bread, and a bit of yeast.  An average dubbel.

Draft.  Poured amber-brown with a medium-sized but quickly dissipating light tan head.  Aroma and flavor struck me as more of a mildly sour ale than a dubbel.  Mildly tart cherries and prunes, a mild yeastiness.  A bit thin, I thought, but quite refined.  Light mouthfeel (particularly for a dubbel).
(750ml bottle) cloudy amber ruby, lasting fine tan head. Nose of raisin, dark fruit, cream. Oats. Taste of oats, raisin, smooth, light alcohol, nice lingerX very well carbonated.

Draft.  Dark brown body with large tan head that mostly dissipates.  Aroma is moderately sweet, cherry, some wood, light caramel, brown sugar.  Taste is medium sweet, cherry, some caramel, light wood.  Medium body, slightly watery.

Not sure I like the way Generaal talks in the 3rd person in the brewer tasting notes. Sounds like George Castanza. The Generaal is not happy if served too cold. Found fresh bottles on a beer store shelf. Amazing what you see if you keep your eyes open. "Ive lost my sight, but not the vision"  Yeasty sludge left in the bottle. Nice foam on dark copper. Big chocolate waffer aroma. Lots of chocolate, choclate waffer, Belgian chocolate, cold hot-chocolate. Very drinkable desert.

A gorgeous pour with a dark Burgundian body, a sparkling carbonation at first with a thick and fluffy beige head. The nose is sweet, candied brown sugar, raisin, caramel, and a sweet taffy throughout. A bit of an odd fruity nose that I cant quite place. Rather sweet and candied with molasses and brown sugar, prune, raisin and cherries. A beautiful caramel and toasted roasted malts. A bit odd and astringent on the finish though. Great brew!

Bottle 33cl, a dark beer with medium head. Nose has dark malt notes as well as an oude brun touch. Aroma is is on sweet caramel, dark malt, lot of fruit, red fruit, prune, light acidity, wood, chocolate, light burnt notes, cherry, good !

Date: September 09, 2012
Mode: Bottle
Source: Rare Beer Club
Appearance: opaque dark brown, big tan head, sudsy lace
Flavor: sweet fruity flavor, rich ripe fruits, chocolate and candy caramel
Overall: sweet rich and fruity flavor, lots of dark fruits enhanced by the eatery sweetness, low balancing phenols, chocolate add richness and depth
Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 8/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 17/20
Rating: 4/5.0Drinkability: 8/10
Score: ***+ /4

A draft pour at THE LOCA:L beer bar in Eureka, CA.  . Pours a dark ruby with brown mixed in with a large and robust tan head leaving good lacing. Nose is of ripe dark fruit. Medium in body with a well carbonated mouthfeel. Flavor is rich with chocolate along with the fruit which tastes like plums and raisins. The finish is dry and not too sweet. This is a very tasty beer, and exceptionally easy to drink.

Tap. Pours murky brown with thin beige head;  decent retention and spare lacing. Aroma is roast and caramel malts, heavy dark fruit (figs, dates, cherries), booze, grassy hops, and yeast. Flavor is sweet malt forward with good dark fruit esters and hops (light bitterness); oak and faint booze undertones with a slightly bitter finish.Med/full body, low carbonation, and medium warmth.

Koffiecreme schuim, rood bruin van kleur , mooi fruit en kruiden in het aroma. Eerste smaak doet een beetje ijzerachtig aan maar verdwijnt snel voor een afdronk van caramel en een beetje fruit. Mooi bittertje op het einde.

Bottle at BCTC. Light dark brown maroon. 1 finger head. Orange wheat and some spices. Pretty sweet but an overall weak scent and taste. "spiced lager" is what friends called it. Not a fan of this overall. The sweetness and spices were dominating.

Dark brown, hazy. Light brown head. very nice, well-balanced 
Dubbel. Rate is somewhat cheesy, some dark fruit, distant chocolate, something funky. Nice one.

Pours a dark garnet with a thick lasting tan head. Aroma is raisin bread and caramel. Taste is raisin, caramel, and dough with some hop bitterness and a hint of alcohol. Creamy texture. Very nice dubbel.

Dark brown coloured and hazy. Has a nice malty aroma, lots of different bread-notes and grain. Light acid too. Sweet flavor, light chocolate, more dark bread, light to moderate bitter finish. Creamy texture and soft carbonation.

Bottle courtesy Hansen and Zita. Creamy off-white good mostly lasting head. Red-amber colour. Moderate malty and hoppy and fruity flavor. Moderate bitter nice fruity flavor. Long moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate. nice.
light toasted bread aroma,brown/golden, clear, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, soft carbonation, light nice finish.
Hazy dark brown beer. Thick tan head. Malty beer with a good dose of ripe dark fruit. Slight alcohol warmth at the end. There is a slight cola quality to it, but generally very good.
Extremely good beer, this is probably the best Ive ever had. Much better than the other classic Belgium beers. Malt taste, nice color.
Bottle. Color dark red with medium head. Aroma malt, roasted, caramel, dark fruits. Taste sweet, roasted, spicy, dark fruits.

Appearance:  lightly hazed mahogany with ruby edges, and a creamy light tan head slowly shrinking to a fat cap.   Aroma: graham crackers, ginger snaps, and clove.   Taste:  toasty malts, a bit of brown sugar, some dark, plummy fruits, and a solid dose of yeasty goodness.   Finish:  notes of prunes or figs, with some caramel and yeasty spice/bitterness.   Notes: Excellent dubbel.  Palate was smooth and rich, but also drinkable.  Flavors were sweet without cloying.   Bottle from the Rare Beer Club.

5/28/12. 750mL bottle. Dark brown pour with a nice tan, almost yellowish head that sticks around and laces a bit. Aromas of roasted malts, dark fruits, yeast, and a hint of metal. Rich roasted malt character with touches of fruitiness and yeast. Pretty solid, if you ask me.

Pours a beautiful unclear amber crimson malt color with a decent beige head. The aroma brings subtle sweet malt and Belgian yeast notes. The flavor of pure smooth malts with some light bitterness settling on the tongue. The body is smooth with medium carbonation, right on the money. Delicious and one of the better Dubbels that I have ever had. The spices that you typically get in a Belgian are lacking for sure, but still a good product.

Pours a deep dark brown with red tint. Pillowy three finger, brown tinted head. Quite a pretty sight. Nose is bitter, slightly earthy - almost reminds me of the nose of a Heineken, though clearly not as bad. Initial head recedes quickly, but lingers at about a finger. Beer is exceptionally smooth - reminds me of a brown ale with more hop bitterness. Notes of coffee, rasins and earth. Definitely a delicious brew.

Draft at Monks. Dark orange brown with a lacey head. Sweet malty aroma. Some noticeable sour brett tang. Medium body. Caramel apple. Dried figs. Slight funk. Smooth finish, though the tangy taste lingers.

750 ml bottle poured a hazy reddish brown with a lasting amber head. Aromas of cola, carmel and light yeast. Palate was light bodied and crisp. Flavors of cola, cocoa, light yeast and light spice with a crisp lingering carmel finish.

Dusty 330 ml bottle at Kulminator. 2008 vintage. Pours a very dark brown with reddish tint and nice persistent head. Aromas of malt and brown sugar toffee. Rich and smooth, with spicy, toffee, and roasted malt flavors. Warm but good balance. A great beer.
Bottle , dark red amber color with rocky white foam, fruit , leather  and dirt aroma, flavor is weak fruit, brown sugar, leathery dust, thin finish

Dumpy 33cl brown bottle (best before 8th Apr 2011) poured into a Westmalle chalice on 23rd Oct 2010. Some of the sediment got into the glass but it still looked good, ruby red body with an off-white head, a bit thin but still a complete covering throughout the tasting.

The aroma was a mild malty molasses mix with toffee and chocolate coming through, but not an in your face sweet, sickly smell.

Interesting taste, malts dominate, semi-sweet like the aroma but with more coffee and chocolate than the toffee mentioned earlier. Not too sure where the alcohol is being hidden because this isnt a thick or heavy beer. It doesnt even seem to appear as the mouth dries and the hop content leaves a slightly bitter dark chocolate aftertaste in the mouth.

A very drinkable brew although Im sure the alcohol would come back and get you in the end if you had more than a couple.

Bottle. Deep amber/brown body with a big, frothy beige head, mostly lasting. Musty aroma with notes of raisins, toffee, chocolate. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly to moderately  bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet and moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture and lively carbonation. Good, but not as bold in the flavor as its 8.8% alcohol and aroma would lead you to believe.

From backlog , back then NEW BEER @ Kulminator 
Head: off white, bubbly/foamy 
Colour: dark brown/black 
Smell: chocoalt, roasted malts, bread, candy sirup, rich and deep ! 
Taste: along the line of the smell , a rich deep somewhat herby ( anise , licquorice )  strong ale with brilliant notes of chocoalt and roasted malts , very good !
Draft at Klooster.  Brown pour with off white head.  Fudgey vanilla aroma.  Flavour also has fudge and vanilla with a little funk.  Finish is pure fudge
2012 - 03 - 26 330ml bottle. red-brown colour.  medium creme head. licorice in aroma. sweet taste.

On tap at the klooster, delft.
Thin off white head.  Clear ruby pour.  Nice beer.
Thick, luxurious head. Thick, sweet smell. Tastes peppery, malty and sweet. A lovely beer that I will continue to buy whenever I see it and am running low.

33 cl bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu. Rated on 13.04.2011
Aroma is spicy with lots of anise and licorice. Also hints of sugar. Flavour is really stuffed with anise and licorice. Also some other spices and brown sugar. Feels a lot like Gouden Carolus Christmas. Not your typical Dubbel.

Beautiful red with a creamy tan head. Very rich in fruit, dark malts, hint of sourness, caramel and cloves. Medium, fizzy carbonation and medium heavy body. Not only a solid sweetness but also some sharp hops. But sticky in the end. Very classic Belgian, but well made. Pleasant drink, if not multiple on a night. (33cl bottle, cheap)

Draft. Brown beer with a beige head. Sweet malt and caramel aroma with spice. Xmas spice and yeast flavor with caramel and light dark fruits. Medium bodied. Xmas spice and caramel lingers with yeast, light dark fruits, and light tartness.
#1167 draught; nose is heavy red apple, decent alcohol, moldy, sweet red berries, feel is medium, carb is medium, taste is sweet malt heavy rotten fruit, cake, medium sour notes
On tap at Monks Kettle. Pours dark brown with a nice beige head and a big dark fruit aroma. There is a slightly sour dark malt flavor with some plum, candi sugar and a soft dry finish. Very tasty.

Bottle at Quinns. Dark red brown colour with small beige head. Aroma is fruit cake, treacle, sweet, caramel. Taste is dark fruit, sweet cake-like, and boozy. Bit of chocolate. Medium to full bodied with a rich finish.

Wine red with a greyish head. Very dark but transparent giving it nice red highlights. No carbonation.
Strong caramel peppery smell with hints of vanilla and dried prunes and raisins. Toffee, wood and alcohol with a nice port-like feel.
The taste is dominated by fizziness and a bitter alcoholic warmth developing into chocolate, making it feel a bit like a liquor-filled bonbon. A bit liek a stout but much more subtle, with a nice woodiness. A very nice beer for winter!

On tap at the Map Room for their 19th anniversary. Pours a cloudy, deep brown colored body with a finger-width, creamy, tan head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is pretty malty sweet with a good amount of dark fruits consisting of raisin, plum, and a touch of cherry. The malts are somewhat bready with a light yeasty spice and herbal hopping. Flavor is similar. Sweeter bready malts with some caramel and a touch of wheat up front. More dark fruits in the middle with some yeast, a touch of chocolate, and more raisins. Gets a bit spicy towards the finish from the yeast and light herbal hops as this dries nicely, but remains fairly sweet and fruity with a touch of roast showing up late as well. Lengthy aftertaste following a medium, smooth body and a moderate carbonation. Overall, a really nice dubbel. Fairly sweet and fruity, but it gets more complex as it warms. I especially liked how this finished. Nice beer.
Draft. Pours amber with an off white head. Light spicy yeasty aroma with sweet and toasty malts. The flavor has dark fruits, spicy yeast, caramel, and some light underlying funky notes. Good stuff.

On tap at the map room. Pours a deep amber brown witha small off white head. Aroma is dark fruits sweet candied character lots of caramel. Flavor dark fruit a toych vinous with some spice yeasty character in the finish with other notes of raisin plum and a sweet caramel finish. Medium body. Ok beer

Draft at maproom, fairly nice beer here.  Big on the noble hops, red fruit and slightly less brown sugar.  The blatant diacetyl is the biggest detractor, bit metallic, touch of blood/iron, light chocolate, grassy bitter vinous metallic hops.

Draught at TND:  Aroma of malt, light dark ripe fruit, slight candi sugar, slight Belgian yeast, slight medicine, light caramel, plum, and fig.  Poured very dark amber/brown in color with a large, creamy, dense, foamy, tan/brown head that greatly diminished but lasted throughout.  Hazy.  Not sparkling.  Very good lacing.  Flavor is medium sweet and slightly bitter.  Tastes of malt, Belgian yeast, banana, light spice, light dark ripe fruit, plum, and hops.  Medium body.  Average texture.  Average carbonation.  Malt, dark ripe fruit, Belgian yeast, hop, finish.  8.8%ABV completely hidden throughout.

Dark brown cloudy beer, beige head. Aroma of malts, yeast, caramel, soy sauce and bread. Flavour is light sweet, light bitter, (roasted) malts, slight chocolate. Nice.
(From 33cL bottle @ home)
Pours a nice cola colored brown. Aromas of dark malts, fruit, and a touch of spice. Has flavors of chocolate, caramel, and a touch of wood.
On draught.  Cloudy brown pour with a medium light tan head.  Aroma of yeast, caramel and bread.  Great medium bodied taste of malt with a faint sweet alcohol finish.
Draft at blind tiger with my son, BAby streets.  Pours a hazy orange gold with no head, with minor white lacing. Aroma is apple hops. Mouthfeel is dry with notes of bitter hops and grass, yeast.
